result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis M Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12:00 PM Defendant Curtis M Wolfe appeared by video, in custody in Jackson.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Curtis M Wolfe.    Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Correctional Right to be personally present at today's hearing explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he e would like to proceed without being personally present in court.  Court finds that defendant agreeing to proceed by phone/video means, and waiving right to be personally present in court for today's proceedings. Count 1: Plea of guilty.  Count2: Dismissed and read-in on State's motion. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Court imposes 6 years in WPS; 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Runs concurrent to 20CF239, 20CF211, 20CF83 and 20CF83.  Court costs imposed of $518 to be paid from held cash bond.  Any remaining cash to be returned to the poster.  ERP and CIP eligible.  Attorney Gill to file credit by Friday afternoon.

Appearances:
State of Wisconsin appears by Atty Hayes.
Attorney Cheryl Gill is appearing via zoom on behalf of defendant. 
 
Court notes a notice was sent to Jackson Correctional with zoom information.
Defendant now appears, at 10:04 via zoom.
Parties wish to set these matters for a plea hearing. 
 
Court would like to transfer matters to Judge Overybey for Waiver of Prelim and
Plea/Sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
